page.title: 01THE HARTSHORNE AREA
page.content: In the Hartshorne area there are quite a few farms. Some of the farmers employ extra people. Some of the men in Hartshorne work down the pits round this area. There are lots of fields around but no housing estates. At the moment the council are putting in sewage pipes. They closed down one road that goes down to Repton and Bretby. There are only two shops in the area and they are small, so people have to go to Swadlincote or Burton to shop. The school in Hartshorne isn't very big but it is very old. There are seventy-six children in the school. We have a Nature Reserve called Carvers Rocks, where there is a big reservoir where all the water birds go. There is a sort of Nature Reserve at Ticknall too, called Ticknall Limeyards.
